item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, March 4, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Translating Natural Language to First-Order Logic for Logical Fallacy Detection (57 points | 23 comments)
2. Bayleaf · Building a low-profile wireless split keyboard (348 points | 107 comments)
3. Learn How to Break AES (86 points | 6 comments)
4. Satellogic's Open Satellite Feed (108 points | 10 comments)

6. DARPA exploring growing bio structures of "unprecedented size" in microgravity (36 points | 15 comments)

8. The Imaginary Engineer – Karl Hans Janke's Flights of Fancy (6 points | 2 comments)
9. Micro keypad to do your regular Git push/pull/add/commit actions (9 points | discuss)
10. Foundry (YC F24) Hiring Founding Engineer to Build an Internet-Scale Web Crawler ( | hide)
11. Show HN: Appstat – Process Monitor for Windows (46 points | 7 comments)

15. Show HN: Open-source Deep Research across workplace applications (10 points | 1 comment)

21. DIY "infinity contrast" TV – with 100% recycled parts [video] (70 points | 26 comments)
22. Show HN: PG-Capture – a better way to sync Postgres with Algolia (or Elastic) (20 points | 6 comments)
23. DeepSeek's smallpond: Bringing Distributed Computing to DuckDB (163 points | 13 comments)
24. Show HN: Fork of Claude-code working with local and other LLM providers (37 points | 9 comments)
25. Small German town starts testing geothermal power utilizing new techniques (32 points | 2 comments)
26. The IBM 650: An appreciation from the field (1986) [pdf] (38 points | 15 comments)
27. SQLite-on-the-server is misunderstood: Better at hyper-scale than micro-scale (307 points | 144 comments)
